clinical_study.brief_title: Maternal Attachment and Depression Anxiety Score Evaluation in COVID-19 Positive Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: Maternal Attachment and Depression Anxiety Score Evaluation in COVID-19 Positive Pregnant Women

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Maternal attachment, Edinburgh depression scoring, and postpartum anxiety scale are evaluated in patients with covid-positive pregnancies in the 3rd month after birth.

detailed_description.textblock: Maternal attachment, Edinburgh depression scoring and postpartum anxiety scale are evaluated in 250 covid-positive pregnant women in the 3rd month after birth. The results will be compared with the results of covid-negative pregnant women who gave birth in the same period.

primary_outcome.measure: Maternal attachment in SARS- cov2 positive and negative pregnant women
primary_outcome.description: Maternal attachment scores evaluated in 250 covid-positive pregnant women in the 3rd month after birth. The results will be compared with the results of covid-negative pregnant women who gave birth in the same period. High scores from the scale indicate high maternal attachment.

primary_outcome.measure: Edinburgh depression scores in in SARS- cov2 positive and negative pregnant women
primary_outcome.description: Edinburgh depression scores evaluated in 250 covid-positive pregnant women in the 3rd month after birth. The results will be compared with the results of covid-negative pregnant women who gave birth in the same period. All questions are scored between 0 and 3 and the highest possible score on the scale is 30. and shows advanced depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Postpartum anxiety scale scores in in SARS- cov2 positive and negative pregnant women
primary_outcome.description: Postpartum anxiety scale scores evaluated in 250 covid-positive pregnant women in the 3rd month after birth. The results will be compared with the results of covid-negative pregnant women who gave birth in the same period. It can be said that the postpartum anxiety levels of those who score 73 and below on the scale are low, those who score between 74 and 100 are medium, and those who score 101 and above are high.

intervention.intervention_name: Maternal attachment, Edinburgh depression scoring and postpartum anxiety scale scores
intervention.description: The results will be compared with the results of covid-negative pregnant women who gave birth in the same period.

study_pop.textblock: Maternal attachment, edinburgh depression score and postpartum anxiety scale scores of 250 covid-19 positive pregnant women between the ages of 18-45 and 250 covid-negative pregnant women are compared.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- covid -19 positive and negative pregnant women
- have no psychiatric illness
- not using antidepressants or antipsychotic drugs
Exclusion Criteria:
- women with psychiatric illness
- using antidepressants or antipsychotic drugs
- not pregnant
- adolescent pregnancy
